release: Juyungo: Afro-Indigenous Music From The Northwestern Andes
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Juyungo: Afro-Indigenous Music From The Northwestern Andes
            
              (Honest Jon's Records)
label: Honest Jon's Records
description:
Honest Jon’s head deep into the Afro-Indigenous cultures of Ecuador’s NW Andes region to reveal the spellbinding musical cultures derived from generations of integration between Chachi & Nigua people and the African Maroons who escaped Spanish slavers from the C.16th onwards - a distinct blend of rhythmelodic vernaculars and hybrid folklores, lushly open to the sounds of insects and bird noise. Gorgeous, entrancing stuff

The 5th in HJ’s intrepid guided tours of... more

label: BLACK TRUFFLE
description:
French composer-performer Léo Dupleix astonishes with his Black Truffle debut, using microtonal tuning to add a sense of wonder to his bespoke arrangements for harpsichord, clarinet, flute, viola, guitar and synth. 'Resonant Trees' reminds us of the possibilities different tunings can open when approached with genuine care and skill - crucial listening if you're into Sarah Davachi, Catherine Lamb, Laura Cannell or Luka Aron.

There's plenty of musicians looking to crack the just intonation... more

label: Amgen
description:
Ingenious, improvising Welsh harpist Rhodri Davies channels Arthur Russell, ancient Indian music, Welsh folk, Cajun blues x avant electronic noise on another full 'artmelt for his Amgen label.

 

With the cywydd (a style of Welsh rhyming verse) of poet Huw Machno (fl 1585-1637) in mind - “Ceimion wrachïod cymwys / Yn siarad bob teimlad twys” (trans. “Precise, angled brays / Speaking every profound feeling.”) - the improvising force of nature Rhodri Davies adapts an Urquhart bray harp... more

title_full:
Bill Orcutt

            —
            How To Rescue Things

label: Warm Winters Ltd.
description: Premiere vinyl edition of Carme López’ debut album of entrancing bagpipe arrangements, on constant rotation here since it came out on tape earlier this year. Unravelling forms of early music and funereal, queered droneworks full of strange tonalities, phased harmonics and curious subversions, ‘Quintela’ comes highly recommended If you’re into the verrrry slow chord-change organ dirges of Kali Malone, Pauline Oliveros’ Deep Listening or Yoshi Wada’s foundational bagpipe... more

title_full:
Harry Gorski-Brown

            —
            Durt Dronemaker After Dreamboats

label: imbalance computer music
description:
On his tenth Monolake album, Robert Henke memorialises his forensic creative process, revising old sketches and dusting off some of his favorite hardware synths to create a lengthy set of sci-fi tinged electroid experiments.

Ten albums in and Robert Henke's still in his own lane, even after inspiring countless copyists. So it's high time for the producer to inventory his process, which he deconstructs in great detail on 'Studio'. His studio is his shelter, he admits, and the place where he's free to... more

title_full:
Gray/Smith

              —
              Heels in the Aisle
            
              (Blank Forms Editions)
label: Blank Forms Editions
description:
Fingerpicking’, storytelling, modal psych-inflected country blues, by veterans of No-Neck Blues Band and Pigeons, calling to mind Sir Richard Bishop or a stoned Bill Orcutt. New from Blank Forms.

“The sophomore effort from Gray/Smith refines their petroleum-based, hard-lullaby sound with a decidedly dusty precision. Formed in the outer-edges of Kings and Richmond counties circa 2020, Gray/Smith is something of an East-coast involution. L. Gray (guitar and vocals) and Rob Smith... more
